author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Assistant Sessions Court here convicted and awarded seven-year imprisonment to a 24-year-old man in an attempt to murder case on Thursday.

Holding that the prosecution had proved the case beyond reasonable doubt, Assistant Sessions Judge S. Ganapathisami awarded the sentence to R. Thirumaran and also imposed fine of Rs. 10,000 on him. The accused should undergo six more months of imprisonment if he failed to pay the fine, the judge said.

The prosecution case was that the accused, who hailed from Koottampuli near RS Mangalam, had attacked his neighbour Sundaram (44), a farmer, with a cricket bat and inflicted serious injuries on him. The victim underwent treatment at Government District Headquarters Hospital here and at Government Rajaji Hospital in Madurai, the prosecution said.

Case registered

Based on the complaint filed by Sundaram’s wife Danalakhmi, RS Mangalam police had registered a case.
title: Youth gets 7-year imprisonment
